Detailed Description

This is the actor class for Dynamic Soft Objects.

This class should be used to make any soft object that, like ActorDynRigid, can be moved or manipulated as a result of force. Examples of soft objects are: Paper, Rope, and Cloth. Semi Rigid bodies that are still somewhat deformable, like Jello, should be made as a soft object.

Adds the actor to the physics world.

Adds the actor to the physics world.
This is automaticly called by the PhysWorlds AddActor function and shouldn't be called manually.

void ActorDynSoft::CreateShapeFromMesh (  ) 

Creates a collision shape from mesh file.

This function will read the location of every verticy in the mesh file and use that to construct a triangle mesh shape and attach it to this objects collision shape.

Creates a soft object for the actor.

Creates a soft object to be placed in the physics world later.
This is automaticly called by the Constructor and shouldn't be called manually.

Definition at line 320 of file physactor.cpp.

void ActorDynSoft::SetBulletLocation ( PhysVector3  Location  )  [protected, virtual]

Sets the location of the physics body.

This will take a PhysVector3 and set the location of the actor within the physics world.
This function is called on by the SetLocation function, and shouldn't be called manually.

Reimplemented from ActorBase.

void ActorDynSoft::SetBulletOrientation ( PhysQuaternion  Rotation  )  [protected, virtual]

Sets the orientation of the physics body.

This will take a PhysQuaternion and set the orientation of the actor within the physics world.
This function is called on by the SetOrientation function, and shouldn't be called manually.

Parameters:
